{"step_by_step_thinking": "The brain has several paired structures, meaning they come in twos, one for each hemisphere of the brain. The vertebral artery, middle cerebral artery, and anterior cerebral artery are all paired structures, meaning there is one on each side of the brain. The basilar artery, however, is an unpaired structure. It is formed by the union of the two vertebral arteries and is located at the base of the brain.", "answer_choice": "A"}
